original_solution_mapping.L1: If Anna can read 1 page in 1 minute, then her speed is 1/1 = <<1/1=1>>1 page per min
original_solution_mapping.L2: If Carole can read at Anna's same speed then her speed is also 1 page per min
original_solution_mapping.L3: If Carole is only half the speed of Brianna, then that means Brianna is twice as fast as Carole, so 2 * 1 page per min = <<1*2=2>>2 pages per min
original_solution_mapping.L4: If a book is 100 pages long and Brianna can read 2 pages per minute, then it will take her 100/2 = <<100/2=50>>50 minutes to read the book

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6331.
    Returns: the time it takes Brianna to read the book in minutes.
    """
    # L1
    anna_pages_per_minute = 1 # 1 page in 1 minute
    anna_minutes_per_page = 1 # 1 page in 1 minute
    anna_speed = anna_pages_per_minute / anna_minutes_per_page

    # L2
    carole_speed = anna_speed

    # L3
    brianna_speed_multiplier = 2 # WK
    brianna_speed = brianna_speed_multiplier * carole_speed

    # L4
    book_pages = 100 # a 100-page book
    time_to_read_book = book_pages / brianna_speed

    # FA
    answer = time_to_read_book
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: If Anna can read {anna_pages_per_minute} page in {anna_minutes_per_page} minute, then her speed is {anna_pages_per_minute}/{anna_minutes_per_page} = <<{anna_pages_per_minute}/{anna_minutes_per_page}={anna_speed}>>{anna_speed} page per min
If Carole can read at Anna's same speed then her speed is also {anna_speed} page per min

If Carole is only half the speed of Brianna, then that means Brianna is twice as fast as Carole, so {brianna_speed_multiplier} * {carole_speed} page per min = <<{carole_speed}*{brianna_speed_multiplier}={brianna_speed}>>{brianna_speed} pages per min

If a book is {book_pages} pages long and Brianna can read {brianna_speed} pages per minute, then it will take her {book_pages}/{brianna_speed} = <<{book_pages}/{brianna_speed}={time_to_read_book}>>{time_to_read_book} minutes to read the book

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: If Anna can read 1 page in 1 minute, then her speed is 1/1 = <<1/1=1>>1 page per min
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: If Carole can read at Anna's same speed then her speed is also 1 page per min
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: If Carole is only half the speed of Brianna, then that means Brianna is twice as fast as Carole, so 2 * 1 page per min = <<1*2=2>>2 pages per min
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: If a book is 100 pages long and Brianna can read 1 pages per minute, then it will take her 100/1 = <<100/1=100>>100 minutes to read the book

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'anna_minutes_per_page' (value: 1) was used instead of 'brianna_speed' (value: 2.0).
